action.action-desc: Ms. Tokuda (for herself, Mr. Begich, Ms. Scholten, and Ms. King-Hinds) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend section 41733 of title 49, United States Code, to require that applications to provide compensated basic essential air service include a contingency plan to continue air service in the event of a disruption, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Essential Air Service Reliability Act of 2025.

section.header: Basic essential air service availability of compensation

subsection.text: Section 41733(c) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking (1) If the Secretary and inserting the following:
by inserting after compensation under this section. the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: For any application submitted pursuant to paragraph (1), such application shall include a contingency plan that provides for the continuation of air service to the eligible place in the event of a disruption that is not related to weather.

subparagraph.text: by striking In selecting an applicant, and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4), as so redesignated, by striking Under guidelines and inserting Rate of compensation.—Under guidelines.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Transportation shall ensure that the amendment made by section 2(a)(2)(B) shall apply not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
Section 41736(c)(2)(A) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking section 41733(c)(1) and inserting section 41733(c).
